replies.msg:
assume sqrt2 =p/q, where p,q are integers and not both even, q not equals 0.

then 2=(p/q)^2
p^2=2xq^2

so p^2 is even
=> p is even

let p=2m, where m is interger

(2m)^2 =2q^2
2m^2=q^2
so q^2 is even
=> q is also even

both p and q aren even. contracdiction occurs.

quote.msg: proof by contradiction
Prove that sqrt(2 )exist .

assume sqrt2 =p/q, where p,q are integers and not both even, q not equals 0.

then 2=(p/q)^2
p^2=2xq^2

so p^2 is even
=> p is even

let p=2m, where m is interger

(2m)^2 =2q^2
2m^2=q^2
so q^2 is even
=> q is also even

both p and q aren even. contracdiction occurs.
